thing-type.label: PSP02 Door/temp/illumination/motion sensor
thing-type.description: Door/temp/illumination/motion sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDoor/Window, motion, temperature and illumination sensor in one device.</p&gt <p&gtPrimarily used as Door/Window sensor, it consists of two parts: magnet and a sensor.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtVery low power consumption.</li&gt <li&gtLow battery battery indication.</li&gt <li&gtDoor/Window status and battery status auto-report.</li&gt <li&gtLED indicator.</li&gt <li&gtOver-the-air firmware update.</li&gt <li&gtTamper proof protection.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPut the Z-Wave Controller in inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtPressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds will enter inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtAfter successful inclusion, the device will wake to receive the setting command from the Z-Wave Controller in about 20 seconds.<br /&gt<br /&gt</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPut the Z-Wave Controller in exclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtPressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds will enter exclusion mode. Node ID has been excluded.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtAny action.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Basic Set Level
parameter.description: Basic command to turn on the light<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSetting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. The 0xFF(-1) means turn on the light. For dimmer equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: PIR Sensitivity
parameter.description: setting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtPIR sensitivity settings. 0 means disable the PIR motion. 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity. High sensitivity means can detected long distance, but if there is more noise signal in the environment, it will re-trigger too frequently.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Light Threshold
parameter.description: setting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSetting the illumination threshold to turn on the light. When the event is triggered and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 0 means turn off illumination detection function, and never turn on the light.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 means darkest.</li&gt <li&gt99 means brightest.</li&gt <li&gt100 means turn off illumination detection function, and always turn on the light.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtNotice: In test mode, only the value in 1 to 99 will enable the illumination detection function and update the illumination value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000002
parameter.label: 5: Operation mode
parameter.description: set test mode if DIP switch in customer mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit1: 1 means test mode, 0 means normal mode.</p&gt <p&gtNotice: This bit only effect by the DIP Switch setting to “customer mode”, otherwise it is decided by DIP Switch setting to Test or Normal Mode.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000004
parameter.label: 5: disable the door/window function
parameter.description: Disable/Enable the function<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit2: Disable the door/window function. (1:Disable, 0:Enable).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000008
parameter.label: 5: temperature unit
parameter.description: set the temperature unit<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit3: temperature scale. 0: Fahrenheit, 1:Celsius</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000010
parameter.label: 5: Disable illumination reports
parameter.description: toggle illumination reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit4: Disable the illumination report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000020
parameter.label: 5: Disable temperature reports
parameter.description: Disable/enable temperature reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit5: Disable the temperature report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1_00000080
parameter.label: 5: back key release action
parameter.description: Disable/enable the back key release into test mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit7: Disable the back key release into test mode. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000001
parameter.label: 6: magnetic integration for lighting control
parameter.description: switch control<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit0: Disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2.</p&gt <p&gt(1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000002
parameter.label: 6: PIR integration to control lighting
parameter.description: PIR integration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2.<br /&gt(1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000004
parameter.label: 6: magetic/pir integration
parameter.description: control lighting in association group 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit2: Disable magnetic integrate PIR to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable, default is Disable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000008
parameter.label: 6: device and lighting in same room
parameter.description: device and lighting in same room<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit3: When Bit2 is 0 (Enable), Are the device and the lighting in the same room? 0: In the same room (Default), 1: In the different room.</p&gt <p&gtNotice: If this bit is 1, it is recommended also set the Bit1 to 1, cause the PIR triggered, doesn’t mean the people in that room.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000010
parameter.label: 6: disable delay to turn off the light
parameter.description: disable/enable delay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit4: Disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1_00000020
parameter.label: 6: light off control
parameter.description: disable/enable auto turn off the light<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit5: Disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtNotice: If bit2 is zero, this setting is useless. If the configuration No.9 is zero, this setting is useless.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000002
parameter.label: 7: motion off report
parameter.description: enable motion OFF report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit1: Enable sending motion OFF report. (0:Disable, 1:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtNote: Depends on the Bit4, 0: Report Notification CC, Type: 0x07, Event: 0xFE 1: Sensor Binary Report, Type: 0x0C, Value: 0x00</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000004
parameter.label: 7: PIR super-sensitivity
parameter.description: enable PIR super-sensitivity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit2: Enable PIR super sensitivity mode. (0:Disable, 1:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000008
parameter.label: 7: BASIC OFF report
parameter.description: Disable/enable report after door closed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit3: Disable send out BASIC OFF after door closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000010
parameter.label: 7: door closed report type
parameter.description: notification or sensor binary report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit4: Notification Type, 0: Using Notification Report. 1: Using Sensor Binary Report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000020
parameter.label: 7: multi CC in auto report
parameter.description: disable/enable multi CC in report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit5: Disable Multi CC in auto report. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000040
parameter.label: 7: Battery state reports
parameter.description: disable/enable battery state reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit6: Disable to report battery state when the device triggered. (1:Disable 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 8: PIR motion re-trigger min interval
parameter.description: PIR motion re-trigger min interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn normal mode, after the PIR motion detection, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, default tick is 3 (24 seconds). Setting the suitable value to prevent sending the trigger signal too frequently. Also can save the battery energy.</p&gt <p&gtNotice: If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR start detecting again.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 9: Light on time hysteresis
parameter.description: time to keep the light on without motion<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAfter turn on the lighting, setting the delay time to turn off the lighting when the PIR motion is not<br /&gtdetected. 8 seconds per tick, default tick is 4 (32 seconds). 0 means never send turn off light command.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 10: battery level auto-report interval
parameter.description: battery level auto-report interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the battery level. 0 means turn off auto report battery. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 11: door state report interval
parameter.description: door state report interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto reporting the door/window state. 0 means turn off auto report door/window state. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 12: illumination auto report interval
parameter.description: illumination auto report interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the illumination. 0 means turn off auto report illumination. The<br /&gtdefault value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 13: temperature report interval
parameter.description: temperature report interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for a temperature auto report. default=12, 0=no auto-report. Tick duration set by parameter 20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: tick duration
parameter.description: auto-reports tick duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report each tick. Setting this configuration will effect configuration<br /&gtNo.10, No.11, No.12 and No.13.&lt;br/&gt; Caution: Setting to 0 means turn off all auto report function.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1_0000007F
parameter.label: 21: temperature differential to report
parameter.description: temperature differential to report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe temperature differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is in Fahrenheit. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. And when the temperature is over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will continue report. Enable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Temperature Report” section</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1_0000003F
parameter.label: 22: min illumination differential
parameter.description: min illumination differential to report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe illumination differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is percentage. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. Enable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Illumination Report” section.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 1: Reports target.
parameter.description: group to send reports to
